dialogues.text: Stolen? What the hell do you mean, stolen? Who steals a body?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Phil is smoking. Larry is driving, his fingers tapping nervously on the wheel. He looks distracted and speaks to break the silence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I still don't fully understand what you do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I do everything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everything?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This little number is for drinking money. By trade I'm a Road Manager.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, one of those.   Like a well- paid gopher.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, not like a well-paid gopher. I'm responsible for movement, maintenance and management. I'm a confidante and a companion, a partner and a patron, an ally, agent and ambassador. I'm like an executive nanny. Not a gopher.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Larry backs down with hint of sarcasm

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An executive nanny, not a gopher. Thanks for clearing that up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bernice cruises along the freeway then takes an exit for Joshua tree.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stanley and the clerk are standing just inside the hangar door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So where are the cops?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The clerk pulls the money out of his top pocket and looks at it. He shrugs his shoulders.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I called them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's supposed to be a funeral in New Orleans. I need to find my boy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: New Orleans?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clerk points into the distance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The man said he's going to Joshua Tree, Louisiana.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joshua Tree?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Susie is moving her suitcases into the sitting room when there is a banging on the front door. Susie opens the doo and Barbara is standing outside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's the son of a bitch?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The son of a bitch isn't here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, he's stolen Gram.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Susie looks bemused.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stolen Gram?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Barbara lights a cigarette.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They had some kind of weird pact. I think Phil's taken Gram out to the desert.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Some kind of voodoo thing with hot wax and dolls to stick pins in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't be ridiculous.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Barbara glances down at the packed bags and smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now that is a wise move, if you ask me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't ask you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The hearse is parked by the side of the road, near a rickety stall where an old lady sits, selling melons. Larry sits inside and Phil walks to a phone by the side o the road. He dials.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The girls are still arguing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You'll learn about Phil Kaufman. If you stick around long enough.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And you know him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know he's a brainless, interfering asshole, yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't need to listen to this garbage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The phone starts to ring. Susie instinctively moves towards it, then stops. Barbara watches carefully.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's him, isn't it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Generally, it's best to answer the phone to discover who's calling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She still makes no move to answer it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She walks across the room and picks up the phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Phil is holding the phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello baby, it's the love machine. How are ya?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Barbara smiles unpleasantly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello Kaufman. I know what you're up to, you thieving bastard. I know where you're going, and I know about your sick, revolting plans, and I'm coming after you. And when I catch you...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Phil looks surprised.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello Barbara. How nice to hear from you again. And so soon...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly the door of the hearse flies open and Larry runs out. Phil holds the phone away from his ear as Barbara's shouting can be heard coming out of the receiver. He watches as Larry just makes it to a cactus and is violent sick. He glances across to where the old melon woman watches, expressionless, from her stall. After a moment, Larry wipes himself down and walks back to the car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry Barb, gotta go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He goes to replace the receiver, and then pops in a last comment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's been real, though.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He puts the phone down, cutting off Barbara's squawk and watches Larry get into the hearse. He frowns.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Barbara slams the phone down. Then she picks up the receiver again and smashes it onto the table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sonofabitch!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She walks to the door, brushing past Susie.   Then she stops.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, honey. Do you want to see who Phil Kaufman really is? Do you want to see what he's capable of?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Barbara shows Susie the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Or maybe you already know I'm right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Susie hesitantly dismisses the challenge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't know shit about him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well why don't we find out?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Barbara turns and walks out.    Susie looks at her packed bags then follows.

dialogues.speaker: INT. HEARSE. DAY
dialogues.text: Phil gets into the hearse, looks back at the coffin and sniffs. He looks down at the air conditioning and turns i up full. Larry starts the engine and the car stalls.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So what's that about?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sunstroke.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Phil shakes his head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You've hardly left the car since we met. How can you have sunstroke?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm susceptible.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Phil doesn't look convinced.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're a winner, that's what you are. A winner...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eventually, the engine catches. Phil immediately gestures at a small road that heads off into the desert.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Turn off here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This isn't the way to Palm Springs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Phil winks at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is if you're a coffin smuggler.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The old woman watches them go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We stay on the old woman and her melon stall as the light rapidly changes, cars and pedestrians whizz by, and an ho passes in moments.

dialogues.speaker: END TIME LAPSE.
dialogues.text: As we slow to normal speed, a car drives past, stops, and reverses back to park by the stall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stanley gets out of the Avis/Budget hire car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good afternoon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He points at a melon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll take that one, please.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fifty cents.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was wondering... Have you seen a hearse pass this way in the last couple of hours?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's it look like?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The question throws Stanley.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well... It... It's a big car. A big yellow car. Two guys inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Was one of 'em sick in them bushes?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well... I don't know.   Maybe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The old woman nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yup.   I seen it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Larry drives and talks, Phil looks tense.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See, the Yin is the negative - the darkside. And the Yang represents positive - good. If you like, the first is earth and the second heaven.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Larry still talks.       Phil now looks bored.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Yin Yang symbol is really evocative about the whole concept. As you travel around the circle, white or black will increase until the opposite color is almost gone. But never totally gone, right? And this cycle then repeats for the opposite color.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Larry still talks, glancing across to Phil to make his point every now and then. Phil is tossing a cigarette int the air and trying to catch it between his teeth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What seems like Yin is often supported by Yang, and vice versa. Let me give you an example: To truly know good, you must first know evil, and without good as a comparison, nothing can be evil. So by allowing Yin to flourish, you welcome Yan. By letting go of Yin, you are waiting for its return. Another example is...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There is a crash, and the car slams to a halt. Larry is thrown forward, but manages to grab the wheel. Phil is no so lucky, and catapults into the dashboard, before being thrown back into his seat, the crumpled cigarette still gripped between his teeth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bernice has driven into a road sign set into a concrete pillar. In fact, the sign that Bernice has driven into is the only thing anywhere near the road for miles in any direction.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Phil is dazed. He checks his forehead, which is bleeding. Then he gazes out at the desolate road and the solitary, buckled sign.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It would be really nice if we could get through a couple of hours without crashing the car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was distracted.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Phil looks out of the window at the vast expanse of nothi but desert.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course you were.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There is a faint noise. Larry hears it first and then Phi and then, as they strain to identify it, they see a tiny dot on the road ahead of them, which grows and grows as they watch it, and they peer hard into the wind to identi it and... it's a motorcycle cop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't believe it. Middle of nowhere, and... quick - stand in front of the car!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They jump out of the car and shuffle sideways, until they are standing in front of the actual point of collision.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What now?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pretend we're having a conversation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The buckled sign hangs dangerously above them as they bot grin at the approaching policeman in a friendly manner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay.   What about?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know what about! Ever since I met you, you've talked. Yabba, yabba, yabba, every waking minute. Religion, your supersonic, supercharged car, the darkside. Now you need to talk, and you can't think of anything to say.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The cop slows down but drives past.        Phil waves at

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whatever your damn fool religion is called, I think it works.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well... it's more a philosophy than a religion.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The cop does a U-turn and motors towards them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, well done. Good work.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He shoots a vicious look at Larry.      The cop parks his and removes his helmet.

dialogues.speaker: CON TINUE D
dialogues.text: As he opens his mouth to speak, a headlight falls off the car and rolls off the road. They all watch it go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Afternoon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Afternoon, officer.    How's it going today?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sign gives an ominous creak.         Larry takes a si step, out of danger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, it's going fine, thank you. How are things with you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fine, fine. We just... stopped to take a look at...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He waves his arm at the desert.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...the fine view you folks have got around here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The cop takes his sunglasses off and takes a look around, as if it's the first time he's seen it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, it is mighty nice around these parts. If you like desert.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They all look appreciatively at the desert, and the cop glances down at the keys in Larry's hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Larry) And how are things with you today, sir?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Larry looks flustered.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ooooh, I'm well. Really well, actually. Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The cop doesn't respond, just keeps looking at Larry with pleasant half-smile on his face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The reason I ask, is that you appear to have driven into one of our road signs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Larry turns and appears to see the huge buckled pole for the first time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm surprised that you hadn't noticed earlier, as it does appear to be impeding your forward progress.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Phil starts to laugh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's a great line...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The cop turns to Phil.        He is still smiling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A long pause.      Then:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wonder if you gentlemen can help me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm looking for some fellows who stole a body back there at the airport.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Larry wobbles with shock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A body?     Stole a body?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A body. Rather like the one in the back of your car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's an empty coffin, officer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The cop ignores him.        Phil lights his cigar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know it sounds strange. But these guys - there are two of them - they stole a body, loaded it into the back of an old yellow hearse painted with flowers, and they're supposed to be driving out this way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Larry thinks hard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hearse.   Flowers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He looks to Phil for support.   Phil raises an eyebrow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think he's onto us, Larry. He's just having a little fun at our expense.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The cop is no longer smiling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the car, please.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Phil opens the door and empty beer bottles cascade out in the road. They get into the car and the cop cuffs them together through the steering wheel and takes the car key Then he walks back over to his bike and starts to talk in the radio.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Phil closes his eyes and shakes his head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: God damn!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He said a body. He said we stole a body.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Phil opens his eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He meant a coffin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He didn't say 'coffin'. He said 'body'. Tell me we haven't stolen a real person.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, the place that I get the coffins from probably haven't filed a report yet. It'll all be sorted out within the hour. Trust me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, I'm just overflowing with trust for you, man. I feel this overwhelming feeling of... trust every time I look at you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He shakes his head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm gonna check inside that box just as soon as we're out of here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They both stare out of the window.        Phil bangs the against the wheel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They sit glowering out of different windows at different bits of desert. The motorcycle cop can be heard talking into his radio.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are we going to do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (bitterly) We're going to be arrested, that's what we're going to do. Then we'll go to court and then we'll go to jail and we'll do that for a while.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Larry mulls this over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about if I could slip out of these cuffs?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Phil treats the theoretical question with indifference.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, that would be great. Then we could suspend you from a bridge in a straitjacket and set the rope on fire.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, really. I really can slip these cuffs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He has Phil's attention now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay.   Show me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Larry pops his middle finger out of its socket, squeezes his hand and slides it out of the handcuff. He hands the other cuff to Phil, who stares at him in astonishment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you think we should go?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, I think we should go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Larry starts the car. He throws it into reverse and the bumper slowly disengages from the metal signpost. Suddenl the car tears loose and flies backwards, smashing into th cop's motorcycle, leaving him holding the radio and its trailing wire. Larry slams on the brakes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh shit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nicely done.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He rolls down his window and addresses the cop, who is staring with horror at his ruined motorcycle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll be moving on, now that your sign no longer appears to be impeding our forward progress.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bernice accelerates away but slowly starts to turn in a wide ark and circles the smashed bike. The cop chases them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Phil screams at Larry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the hell are you doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The steering lock is on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well...   turn it off!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't - he's got the keys.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Phil turns to watch the chasing policeman.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, we've escaped but we can only drive in a circle?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They do another circuit. The exhausted cop stops, breathing heavily, and then watches in astonishment as th hearse turns and heads back towards him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Phil and Larry stare at the policeman out of the window a the car sweeps past. The cop gets his gun out of his holster, and Phil reaches into the glove box and pulls ou the screwdriver. He leans across Larry, jams it into the wheel column, and snaps the steering lock in two. The hearse's direction immediately changes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can we please go?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The hearse roars away and the cop watches it go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Barbara drives and Susie sits in the passenger seat.   It doesn't look as if they've spoken for hours.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you hate Phil so much, why are you chasing him across California?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's got Gram and I need him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, that's really touching. But... you've got to come to terms with the fact that he's dead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Barbara shoots her a withering look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know he's dead, Honey. But he hasn't been officially identified, and there's no certificate of death.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't understand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's just say I'm overly sentimental, okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is all about money, isn't it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Isn't everything?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why do you think you deserve anything?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was a great support to Gram before Kaufman came along and spoiled the party.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Phil's not responsible for your problems with Gram.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you know?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know that he can be a pain in the ass, but when it came to Gram, Phil only ever did the right thing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In his whole life, Phil Kaufman didn't do anything because it was the right thing to do. You can bet the ranch that wherever he is, he's having some fun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe that's what I like about him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure it is, honey. That's why your bags were packed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have you any idea what it's like to really love someone?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Barbara laughs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You might exclusively love Phil Kaufman - but unfortunately, so does he. You're just handy to have around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't have to listen to this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Susie leans over, grabs the safety brake and pulls it up hard. The car swerves and skids to a stop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, you vindictive bitch. I'm going with you to Joshua Tree because my life seems to have been turned upside down and I want to know why. But you don't know me and I won't let you judge me. Do it again and I'll smash that pretty little face of yours off the fucking road. Got it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Barbara dismisses her anger with a tight little smile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The truth can hurt, can't it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Phil finishes his beer, rubs his eyes and slumps back in his seat. He looks terrible, but not as bad as Larry who is pasty and sweating.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, that's it! They're going to lock me up and throw away the key.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why would they do that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You saw what happened. I drove over that cop's bike. That's destruction of police property, or something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You worry too much.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not 'til I met you...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Phil finishes his beer and peers at the empty bottle. The something catches his eye and he leans forward in his sea

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus - what the hell is that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A large plaster dinosaur appears ahead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a dinosaur.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Very perceptive.   What's it doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As they get nearer, they can see that the huge model is carrying a sign.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (reads) 'The Polyonax Place'. (aside: to Phil) A Polyonax is probably some kind of dinosaur.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Phil shoots him a look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (reads) 'Dinoburgers, Reptile Steaks and Primeval Soup. Titanosaurion portions, prehistoric pricing. Liquor served'.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pull over - let's... eat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's not. The cops'll be after us and we should just get on to Palm Springs and do the thing, and then I can get home and you can... do whatever it is you do. Let's do that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We need to stop. I'm starting to get hungry. I'm not nice hungry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You surprise me.    I vote we keep going.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What gave you the impression this was a democracy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The hearse pulls up around the back of the building, and parks in a place that is hidden from the road. Phil gets out and stretches. He is joined by Larry, and they both peer round the side of the building to check that they ha not been observed. Then they walk towards the entrance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A Police Car with siren blaring and lights flashing speed past on the road.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We are with a short-order cook. He expertly flips a burge from a hotplate and adds it to a plate overflowing with bacon, sausage and fries. He slips this plate onto a tray on which there is a second plate containing two pieces of plain bread and some lettuce. He dings a bell and a waite enters and picks up the tray. We move with the tray as he carries it from the kitchen and into the dining area. He stops at the bar to load three foaming glasses of beer an a glass of water onto the tray, and delivers it to Phil a Larry, who are sitting in a window booth. Larry has his head resting on the table. He lifts it as soon as the foo arrives.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You frighten him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I do not.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone else, he announces the food when he brings it. Diplodocus this and Allosaurus that. Us he just slaps it down and runs for cover.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They both look at Larry's bread and lettuce.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's probably the rabbit food.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, I'm a vegetarian. I have a problem with dead flesh. Okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I understand. Really I do. That stuff'll mess you right up every time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Phil picks up the first beer and downs it in one go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stanley is driving along the road. He puts his hand in hi pocket, takes out his hip flask, pops the lid and goes to take a drink. It's empty. Then he notices the dinosaur.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Phil pushes his full plate away and finishes off the thir beer. He gets up. Larry notices he hasn't eaten anything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought you were hungry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Phil ignores him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gotta make a call.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He glances around and then walks over to the bar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey man, where's the phone?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Out back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He jerks his head by way of direction. Phil wanders off just as the door opens and Stanley walks in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good afternoon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yup.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you have a telephone I might use?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In a minute, I do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In a minute?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.    Phone's for customers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stanley looks confused.           Then he understands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd better order, then.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stanley picks up a menu.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Phil dials a number on the phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sitting room is empty.          The phone rings.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When it becomes clear that no one is going to answer, Phi replaces the receiver and walks back into the diner. He pushes past Stanley as he goes to the bar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Phil joins Larry and puts a bag of beers on the table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Speak to her?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your girlfriend?      Your wife?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: None of your damn business.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So you didn't?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A pause.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe she's out.      Shopping, or something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Phil pours the rest of his beer down his throat, before signaling the barman to serve him another.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, that'll be it.     Shopping.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He raises an eyebrow at Larry. Behind him, we see Stanley walk in and take a seat at the bar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to barman) Beer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The barman gives Stanley his beer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Would you put a scotch in there, please?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He pours the spirit in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bad day?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stanley rubs the top of his head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeaaaaah.    Yeah, a real bad day.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What happened?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My boy died out here the other day, and some punks have stolen his body.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stanley reaches for his pocket.          The barman puts up to refuse the money.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's worth a shot on the house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The barman tips a little more scotch into the beer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stanley takes a drink.     Phil slips some money on the b and stands up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Larry) We gotta go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Larry is listening to the conversation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Haven't finished my drink.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Stanley) Why would someone steal a body?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Phil picks up the glass of water and drinks it down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All gone.     C'mon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He turns and walks to the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, maybe they were souvenir hunters or something. My boy's kinda famous...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who is he?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Phil is back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gram Parsons.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Barman looks surprised.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gram Parsons?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Phil reaches across and grabs the back of Larry's jacket.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gram Parsons?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Both the Barman and Stanley look round, but Larry's stool is now empty, spinning. He and Phil are already at the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Phil propels Larry outside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gram Parsons? Is Gram Parsons dead?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Better get going.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He said someone took Gram Parson's body. Two people...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, he was a real blabbermouth. In fact, I thought he was never gonna stop talking. Anyway, although that's real interesting, we've gotta keep to the schedule.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Schedule? What schedule?   There is no schedule...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I think we should just make our delivery as soon as possible, don't you? Get our package to Palm Springs. Remember?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Larry looks horrified.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Package?   We've stolen that man's son.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stolen... his son? That's outrageous! I'm appalled that you could even think we'd do such a thing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They move round the back of the Polyonax Place, where Bernice is hidden behind an outhouse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know what you take me for. I want to see in that box.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Larry walks round to the back of the car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We've really got to go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Larry swings open the back window and pulls at the casket

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's heavy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Phil glances at his watch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, then. Well, if you're satisfied, let's go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I said it's heavy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Heavy, yes. Well, it is made of wood. Wood is heavy. Actually.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, I remember.    Finest poplar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Larry slides the top of the casket off and looks inside. He recoils.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesusjesusjesus...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He drops the lid and looks at Phil, horrified.   Phil wal over and looks inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gosh, they must have given us a full one. We'll have to sort that all out when we get to Palm Springs and...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Larry is staring at him with horror.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh my God.     You stole Gram Parsons.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Phil gives up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, technically, we stole Gram Parsons.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I stole a coffin, I didn't know there was a body in it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd save that line for court.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the enormity of the news starts to sink in, Larry hops up and down in panic. Phil watches him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you doing now?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Larry is losing control.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know! What am I doing? I mean... What-am-I-doing? Why am I here? Why am I with you? WHAT IS GOING ON?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Calm down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought it was bad enough when I ran over the cop's bike, but now I'm a fucking body snatcher.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, when you've quite finished, we should go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Larry goggles at him.     His voice takes on a level of hysteria.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go? You go. I tell you what I'm going to do. I'm going inside and I'm going to give that man his son back. I'm going to do the right thing, I'm going to follow my conscience, I'm going to...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Larry walks towards the bar, then quick walks, then runs. Phil tackles him around the legs and they both fall. Larry's head hits the ground hard and he lies there unconscious.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Phil picks him up, slings him into the passenger seat, an slides behind the wheel. The hearse moves off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stanley takes another drink and glances out of the window just as the bright yellow hearse drives past. He stands u and walks to the window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Son of a bitch!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The hearse picks up speed and powers down the highway out into the desert.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Susie seethes and Barbara smokes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're not a very nice person, are you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nice? No, I suppose not.    Does it matter?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Susie looks surprised.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It might get you further.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I do okay. Listen, I was an orphan at fourteen and a waitress at fifteen. I do what I do because it puts food on my table, and because if I don't look after myself, no-one else will.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So what do you want from us?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't want anything from you. It would be a bonus to see Kaufman crash and burn, but I don't need to be there when it happens.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why do you hate Phil so much?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Barbara lights another cigarette.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gram was the first good guy I ever hooked up with. He wasn't perfect, but it worked between us. We just seemed to fit together. But Gram was already wild, and I made him wilder. Kaufman watched over him like a hawk, and when he felt things were getting out of control, he turned Gram against me. I lost the only decent thing in my life.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Surely Phil was just looking after Gram?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gram was an adult.   He didn't need a nursemaid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Except that now he's dead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. Without my help and while Kaufman was babysitting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Silence for a moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't like you much, Barbara.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's fine. I just want what's mine and then I'm gone. Gone real fast.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The hearse powers through along the desert highway. They pass a sign which reads 'If You're Looking for the Joshua Tree National Monument, You're Getting Close. If You're not, You're Getting Lost...'

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Phil is getting very tired, his vision is blurring and he shakes his head to wake himself up. He glances across and sees that Larry is awake and staring at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Welcome back, hippie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So why d'ya do it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have a guess.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There is a moment's silence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I gave my word.   This is what Gram wanted.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What, cruise around the desert until he starts to smell? Were you - both bombed?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Phil looks offended.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you have friends?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course I have friends.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, what would you do for them?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anything, within reason.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Phil stares out of the window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's what I hate about people like you. Everything's 'within reason'. There are always boundaries, provisos. You only operate with a safety net.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Larry is confused.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell me something - if it was the other way round, would Gram be sitting here, driving your bones out into the desert?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Phil says nothing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You've missed the point. See, it doesn't matter what he would do, or what you and your tie-dyed friends think is the correct way to behave. To me, it only matters what I do. Where you have boundaries and limits and thresholds - I only have right and wrong. If I make a promise, I keep it - that's right. If I break that promise - that's wrong.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Phil rubs his eyes, tired. Suddenly, Larry smashes Phil across the head with a bottle of Jack Daniels. Phil slump back in the seat and Larry, dropping the bloodied weapon, reaches across to grab the wheel and slow the hearse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bernice fishtails across the road as Larry struggles to retain control. It eventually slides to a halt. Larry gets out and runs round to the drivers' door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Larry stares down at Phil.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ohmygod.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He slides Phil across the seat and slips behind the wheel He shouts at the unconscious Phil.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You made me do it, you bastard! I've never hit anyone in my life, but you pushed and you pushed and... you gave me no choice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Larry prods Phil to ensure he's unresponsive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The hearse executes a wide U-turn before gently rejoining the highway and heading back towards town. A moment after completing the turn, the one remaining headlight stutters and goes out. Bernice pulls off the road.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He flicks the headlight switch, but to no avail. Then, in the distance, he sees a car approaching. Stanley can be glimpsed in the driving seat as the car flashes past.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit.   Shitshitshit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bernice rejoins the road and drives slowly off into the darkness after Stanley.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Phil is motionless, and Larry peers out into the darkness as the car limps on, lit only from the light of the moon. Larry sees a glow in the distance ahead, and drives towar a neon sign; 'Welcome to the Joshua Tree Inn'.

dialogues.speaker: CON TINUE D
dialogues.text: He stops by the entrance to the inn and stares at Stanley car parked in the bay outside room 8. He glances across a Phil, turns the car around and drives in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bernice glides to a stop in the bay next to Stanley's car Larry gets out and looks around. After a moment, he walks over to the door of room eight and knocks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A tired-looking Stanley opens the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They stare at each other.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Um. I'm one of the guys that took your son.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: After a moment, Stanley steps back and opens the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You'd better come in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A car drives past the inn and then brakes sharply and ski across the road. It reverses and pulls in, parking next t the hearse. Barbara and Susie get out and look around. Then Susie walks over to the hearse's passenger window an raps on the glass, and Barbara marches to the back of the hearse and attempts to open it. She can't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's the catch on this piece of shit?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Susie notices Phil, slumped in the seat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Phil?    Phil!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Phil comes to. He looks out of the window at Susie, then at the 'Joshua Tree' sign, then at the door to room eight then round to the back of the shaking hearse as Barbara tries to get the door open. His jaw drops open and he rub his eyes again, before getting out of the car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Phil stands in front of Susie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What happened to your head?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He touches his head and looks at the blood on his fingers His handcuff hangs from his wrist and Susie stares at it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A hippie hit it.   I thought you'd gone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hold that thought.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the hell does that mean?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I need to know what it is you're doing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Barbara shouts from the back of the car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I told you what he's doing! He's going to set fire to my Gram in some freaky ceremony with witches and black magic and... dolls.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dolls?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dolls to stick pins in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the hell are you talking about?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shouts) I want my man back!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Enough of this shit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Phil walks over to the door of room 8.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They've gotta be in here.    It's fate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He opens the door and walks in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Larry and Stanley are sitting on the bed.          Phil s vicious look at Larry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whatever happened to peace, love and understanding, hippie?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're Kaufman?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yup.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stanley folds his arms.         Susie and Barbara follow the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And you are?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm with him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She indicates Phil.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello Stanley. Remember me?     The psychotic girlfriend?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello Barbara. Nothing wrong with your memory.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He turns to Phil.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you sell tickets or something? Now, you boys want to tell me why you stole my son?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I didn't even know he was in the box.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm going to cremate him, here in the desert where he felt most at home. That's what he wanted.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The hell you are, Kaufman.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stanley picks up the phone and starts to dial.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know I can't let you do that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know you have to.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stanley smashes the receiver down onto the table.   Every jumps.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't have to do anything, Mister Kaufman. This is MY loss! This was MY son! How dare you try to take my grief away from me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's too late to claim him now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the hell does that mean?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They are almost nose-to-nose now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It means that you were never there when it mattered to Gram. It means that you stopped being a father the moment he stopped doing your bidding. It means that you learned to care too late. That's what it means.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't have to justify my relationship with Gram to you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not to me, no.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stanley sits down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's true that when Gram left college, we drifted apart.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He was a disappointment to me, because he wouldn't use his brain. He had so much to offer, but he let it trickle away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No - he gave it his all, but in a way you could never understand. And all he ever wanted from you was approval. He wanted you to be proud of what he had achieved.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I kept everything. Every record, every article, every photo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's no good telling me.   You should have told him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I loved him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Too late...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stanley looks up at Phil.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I understand that you were his right-hand man, as well as his friend?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was both, yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And that you weren't there when he died? When he needed you most?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A beat, then:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.    That's right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So the guilt isn't all mine, then?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I guess not.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Susie walks over and takes Phil's hand. Stanley says nothing for a moment, but his eyes fill with tears.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You boys took away my son. I lost him once in life, and now you're trying to take him from me again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He starts to cry. Larry shoots an imploring look at Phil. Barbara glances around the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can we just cut through this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She gestures at Phil and Larry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You two stole the body. Theft.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Indicates Susie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sweetie, I'm sorry, but you seem to be in the whole thing up to your neck. Accessory.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Waves a hand at Stanley.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And you are an old fool who should have called the police, but hasn't. Stupidity.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She walks over to the phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now, let's just call the cops and get it done. The sooner we get us a death certificate and bury him, the sooner his soul will be properly laid to rest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Phil walks over to Barbara, picks her up and carries her into the bathroom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey! What the hell are you doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He emerges and slips the back of a chair under the handle effectively locking the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Son, you had your chance to look after Gram, and now he's dead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There is a 'bang' from the bathroom, and the door shakes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bastard!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I only failed because I couldn't save him from himself. You failed him all his life. You never believed. I never doubted.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stanley pauses.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay. You tell me why I should let you take my boy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was his road manager and his friend. We loved it out here in the desert, and we made a pact that whoever died first, the other would come down here and set them free. Gram gave his word and I gave mine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stanley thinks about this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're a couple of druggies.   Why should I believe you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Phil doesn't like the inference.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't take drugs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Another 'bang' from the bathroom.   Stanley turns to Larr

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about you? Are you a druggie?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There is a long pause.    Then:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.    Yes I am.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Phil closes his eyes. Stanley picks up the receiver and starts to dial. Then Phil jumps up off the bed and walks out of the room. After a moment, Larry and Susie follow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Phil is waiting by the car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Larry) Nice work. Let's go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Larry gives Phil the screwdriver.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't do this.      This isn't right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Larry walks away leaving Phil with Susie.         He look

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just do whatever feels right to you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: God damn!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: After a moment, Phil walks back into room eight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stanley is sitting on the bed, the receiver in his hand. Phil sits facing him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you call them?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you going to call them?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, you haven't given me a reason not to.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There is another 'crash' from inside the bathroom. door shakes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There isn't a reason. If someone tried to steal my son's body, I'd stop them. For sure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Larry and Susie quietly enter the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So you are prepared to go to jail?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm expecting to.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't you worry - it's gonna happen!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mister Parsons?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Phil and Stanley look up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is it, son?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've been a junkie for over four years. I started taking heroin on June 5th 1969 at a concert in Indiana. I...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't need...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Larry holds his hand up to stop Stanley.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've taken heroin, speed, uppers, downers, blues, morphine, methadone, mushrooms, quaaludes, acid, valium, barbiturates, straight LSD, marijuana, marijuana laced with opium, nembutal, mescalin of course, and medical methaqualone, which made me shake uncontrollably for six weeks and vomit every hour.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (dryly) That's very impressive, son.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not my point.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Better make the point.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I started working my way through that list on June 5th 1969, and since then there hasn't been a day when I didn't at least smoke one joint.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Phil shoots Larry a dangerous look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are we sure that this is helping?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Larry ignores him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And now I've stopped. I stopped because it seems that I had something more important to do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They all look at him.   He gestures at Phil.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's doing this because he gave his word. I'm prepared to do this now because I think it's right. And because I believe that each body has a soul. And Gram's soul doesn't belong in a family plot surrounded by strangers. It belongs here, where he was happiest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the silence, Susie walks over and grips Phil's hand. Then Stanley gets up off the bed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm going to go say goodbye to my son.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone looks surprised. Phil gives Larry a look of appreciative approval. Barbara starts to kick furiously a the door from inside the bathroom. Stanley pauses for a moment, and then walks outside. Phil and Larry watch him go, and Susie walks over to kiss Phil.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's that for?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's for failing to reinforce my expectations.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well... I'll have to do that more often.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The three of them move to the door, and Phil turns to Larry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you really take all those drugs?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course not.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He grins at Phil.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I may have got a little carried away...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The door of the bathroom shakes and one of the hinges fli across the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: C'mon, time to go...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Phil, Larry and Susie leave room eight. They look around with surprise, but there is no sign of Stanley. Phil open the back of the hearse and takes a quick peek inside the casket.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just checking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, he took the body and stuffed it in the trunk of his car before escaping into the night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Larry is already behind the wheel.   Phil opens the car d and looks at Susie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you coming?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She smiles at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I reckon I am.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She gets in. There is a final, almighty 'crash' from inside room eight. The three of them look at each other, and then Bernice is gone into the darkness. A moment late Barbara runs outside. She leaps into her car and screeche after them. In the distance a blue flashing police light suddenly materializes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Barbara is on the road, driving fast. Suddenly a blue flashing police light fills her mirror.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank God!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She pulls over and the police cruiser pulls in behind her The traffic cop walks up and looks through the window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Evenin' ma'am.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Barbara gives it everything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please help me, they've got my boyfriend's corpse and they're going to perform a ritual with his body.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The cop turns on his torch and peers at her carefully.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: May I see your driving license please, ma'am?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My driving license?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've just told you that they've stolen a body and you want to see my driving license?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He just stares at her.      Barbara is losing it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You people are supposed to be on the lookout for a hearse. A hearse is a big long car. You can usually tell which ones are the hearses, because they have coffins in the back. The one we're looking for is painted yellow. Does this look like a yellow hearse to you, asshole?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Long pause. Barbara realizes that she might have gone too far. He starts to write a ticket.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is that a ticket? Are you writing me a ticket?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes it is, ma'am. And yes I am.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Phil indicates an area just off the road.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cap Rock. This is perfect. Really peaceful...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Larry pulls the hearse over near the rock. They all sit there for a moment. Phil and Larry look at each other.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Phil opens the back of the hearse and slides the casket o of the car. He notices that Larry has made no move to help. Susie sits on a rock and watches.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You wanna give me a hand here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Larry walks over and grabs the other end of the casket. They walk it away from the car and lay it down. As they lower it, the coffin slips out of Phil's hands and bangs down in the sand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry, Gram.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They stand and stare at the casket.      Susie walks over the guitar and takes Phil's hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What now?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now we... do it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He gets the gasoline can from the car and stands over the casket.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take the top off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Flesh burns easier than wood.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't believe you just said that. I'm not taking the top off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He walks off. Phil puts the can down and removes the top of the casket. He peers inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Gram) Hey, man. Looking a little peaky...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Some decorum would be nice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He pours some gasoline into the casket.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you think that's enough?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Against his better judgment, Larry walks over and peers inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I don't know.   Maybe a little more.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Phil pours a little more fuel in.       He looks over at

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Enough?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not having a conversation with you about how much gasoline you need to burn a body.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She backs off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think that'll do it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Phil stops pouring and shakes the can.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Only a little left.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He pours the rest of the can into the casket. Susie walks over to stand next to Phil. He looks down at Gram.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry I wasn't there for you when it mattered, but I was there before, and I've been there ever since. Gram, good luck to you, wherever you are.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They all stare at the casket. Phil wipes a tear away and tucks a can of beer into the coffin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's my last one, man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He rests Gram's guitar against the casket, takes big puff on his cigar to get the flame up, then tosses it into the coffin. They wait. Nothing happens. Phil edges nearer and looks inside. Then the coffin explodes into flames. All three of them are thrown backwards by the blast.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The traffic cop is finishing the ticket when there is a ball of flame in the distance. Barbara just scowls.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus!    What the hell's that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That'll be Gram Parsons, on fire.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get in the car, ma'am.   Now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Phil, Larry and Susie pick themselves up. They stare at the pyre. Phil is close to tears, and Susie puts her arm around him. For a moment, Phil thinks he sees the flames morph into the shape of an angel over the burning coffin. The image disappears when Larry speaks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe too much fuel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nah, I just didn't factor in the booze inside of him. Gram always...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He breaks off as a flashing police light appears in the darkness, followed by a siren.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think our work here is done.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Larry and Susie run to the car. Phil lingers a moment, looking down at the flames. Then he follows the others.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Phil jumps into the car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The huge car screeches off into the darkness, with no lights.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stanley watches as the hearse flies past him. He glances back at the fire, smiles sadly, and bows his head for a moment. Then he turns on the ignition and drives away int the darkness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The police car arrives at the scene.       Barbara and th get out. He peers into the flames.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How do you know it's your boyfriend?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sarcastically) I recognize that birthmark on his shoulder. Look, can I make an observation?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Be my guest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're in the desert. It is dark. If you want to catch someone in the dark, it's best not to turn on big flashing lights and make a loud noise with a siren.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you want to know what I think, ma'am?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. But I'm really, really keen to find out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The traffic cop stares into the fire.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think it was suicide. He just wanted to get away from you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Phil is fast asleep and snoring in Bernice's passenger seat. He wakes slowly and shields his eyes from the brigh sunshine that pours through the windscreen. He pulls a flask out of the glove compartment and takes a long gargl spitting the result out of the window.

dialogues.speaker: CON TINUE D
dialogues.text: Then he glances in the rear view mirror and sees the man sitting in the casket bay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure is hot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello, Gram.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Phil.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gram pulls himself along the bay and onto the back seat. He then climbs into the front, settles next to Phil and holds his hand out for the flask.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you think you should?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not gonna hurt me now, is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He takes a drink and looks around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nice wheels. Very stylish.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're very handy for transporting dead people around. Nothing better.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am dead, then?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're more than dead, Gram. You and the box are down to bones and brass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, well.    Here's mud in your eye.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He takes another drink and hands the flask back to Phil.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What can I do for you, Gram?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You assume I want something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, you're here. And seeing as I just burned you to a cinder, you shouldn't be.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So I'm guessing you've got some kind of reason.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, okay. I just wanted to say thanks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What for?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doing the thing that we agreed, keeping your word, keeping them all away...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, that's okay, Gram.    But I don't need thanking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm just taking care of business. That's what you paid me for - that's what I do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gram grins.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You shooting for a raise?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Actually, I just quit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gram holds his hand out for the bottle and takes a drink.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I s'pose I should be getting along.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Goodbye, Gram. I'm glad it all worked out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I said I'm glad it all worked out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And Gram is now Larry, peering down at Phil.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All what worked out?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Phil sits bolt upright and looks around the car.   Larry Susie stare back at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doesn't matter. Can we go now? I'm getting sick of sand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We hear Gram's: 'Return Of The Grievous Angel' or some similar music.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We follow Bernice as she drives through the desert, and into Los Angeles. We follow her through the city streets, and we stay with her as she parks. Fade down music.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Phil turns off the ignition and sits back in his seat. and Larry look at each other.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, we did it.    We saved a soul.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He leans across to hug Phil, who looks awkward and pats h on the shoulder instead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Singed my damn mustache, that's for sure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Phil pulls a cigar out of his pocket and lights it. The handcuff dangles from his wrist and bangs against the das He stares at the match as it burns.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, shall we?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Phil blows the match out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.    Let's roll, hippie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They all get out of the car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Phil turns to Susie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where d'you think you might be when I'm done?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll be waiting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, but where?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There is a small moment of tension, before Phil grins at her. They kiss.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get out of here.   Finish it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Phil pats Bernice's battered wing as he walks away and ov to where Larry is waiting. They cross the road and walk into a building through heavy wooden doors. Pull back to reveal a sign: 'Los Angeles Police Department'. FADE UP ON SUPER: Phil Kaufman and Larry Osterberg appeared in West L.A. Municipal Court on November 5, 1973 Gram Parsons's 27th birthday. Since a corpse has no intrinsic value, the two were charged with misdemeanor theft for stealing the coffin and given a token punishmen $708 in damages for the coffin, and a $300 fine for each the bodysnatchers.
